Huge, and I mean huge, bedroomâ€¦ total comfort! Seriously magnificent cooked to order breakfasts, fresh fruit & juices. Just down the street from the food markets & a short stroll to all the sights. While it doesnâ€™t have a bar, a total treasure just on the adjoining street is By the Wine wine/tapas bar. What are you waiting for?â€¦ just book it ;-)

review_title: An opportunity to stay in a great location in a city that invites you to walk and explore.
review_text:
Everything about this hotel is totally delightful. It genuinely feels like a home and makes you feel like a house guest. 
Everyone is incredibly helpful, engaging and enthusiastic and the breakfast is outstanding.

Negative: There is almost nothing to dislike.  We stayed for a long weekend and perhaps a longer stay might show some negatives but from our stay we have none.  If one wanted a bar or gym this is not the place but if you seek a luxury laidback boutique this is perfect.

The staff here were wonderful. Our flight arrived at 10:30 at night so we didn't get to the apartment until after 11. They stayed just to make sure we got in and were so helpful. Loved the breakfasts - fresh fruit, eggs, toast and bread, pastel de natas, coffee, juices, cheese and ham. 

The rooms are very clean and comfortable. I was unfortunately not feeling well during my stay here so had breakfast in my room and layed in bed all day while my husband and daughter explored, but it was a cozy and comfortable place to stay while not feeling well. 

Also in a great location!

review_title: great location, walking distance to anywhere you need in Lisbon
review_text:
the location is excellent and I like that it is a smaller hotel that really had reasonable amenities, the breakfast was good for the size of facility and they strived to help in many ways, with suggestions for places to eat and see, help with setting up appointments and reservations, etc.

Negative: they indicated that they had a bar and this really isn't true, there was a tiny honor bar cart that was frankly 99% empty which is not a bar per se, nor any in room refrigeration, which prevented even having a few beers or bottle of wine ready for when you want it,  not a big deal but need to remove mention of having a bar as they don't.  Lots of places very near to have a beverage. Beds hard a a rock, so if you like a firm bed this is your place

Incredible location, near amazing bars, restaurants, coffee shops as well as public transport. We walked to most places and then decided to get the day pass for public transport to visit some locations that were a bit further away. The staff were lovely, the hotel itself is very clean and we were able to get some gluten free bread for dietary requirements. We asked for a quiet room and so our windows were facing a little backstreet which was lovely and indeed very quiet. The room looked out to an amazing wine bar called By The Wine which is another little gem and perfect for some food and delicious wine. Overall we had an amazing 3 night stay and would definitely come back to this hotel!

Negative: Although we had a quiet room, and there was no street noise, there was lots of moving around and some noise coming from upstairs everyday around 7.30am. It didn't bother us too much as we were up at that time but if you're looking for a longer sleep you might need some ear plugs!

The staff could not have done more for us and made us feel so welcome from start to finish! Exceptional service.

If we were staying longer, we'd have probably stayed out later as well so don't think this would've mattered so much.

review_text: It was such a treat to stay at this hotel. The hotel itself is beautiful and has so many wonderful details. The location is within perfect walking distance of a lot of places to visit in Lisbon.  I would definitely stay here again on our next visit!

It was the final nightâ€™s stay in Lisbon for our party of 8 women celebrating friendship and an annual girlâ€™s trip - indeed it was a highlight and lovely finish to an amazing stay.

Magnificent breakfast: perfectly curated and had everything we loved! Probably the best one we've had to date. The location of the hotel was superb, and the staff was really nice and helpful. Rooms were ample and each had an own AC unit, nicely decorated as well! We also liked the use of codes instead of having to carry keys with us.

Negative: Our rooms were in the basement, and after heavy rains it really smelled a bit funky. Additionally, it must've been some strong cleaning soaps that were used, giving the rooms a strong scent as well. The beds were hard, although some people might appreciate that. Our room's huge window was street level where people tended to e.g. lean on and have a smoke in front of it, so we felt like we were in a fishing bowl and needed to keep everything shut during our entire stay. The staff was great, but many times hard to locate (rarely at front desk).

review_title: Staff, location, breakfast, room.... all excellent.  We could not have chosen a better hotel.
review_text:
Everything about the hotel was excellent.  A beautiful hotel in a central location.  
We wanted a small boutique hotel and this delivered that in bucket loads.  It's a charming place where the staff go over and beyond to be helpful with advice/service to make the stay a little bit more special.  It was my partners' birthday whilst we were there so they gave him a cake to mark the special day - very thoughtful.

Negative: There was nothing I didn't like so these are only minor observations I offer to follow travellers .  The bathroom (to Room 10) could have been a little bigger ( that would be difficult to achieve now without building work) but it was sufficient for our needs.  Note that all the rooms do not have a safe so if this is important guests are asked to let the hotel know in advance.  Our room was towards the back of the hotel overlooking the excellent ('By the Wine' wine bar)  which meant there was some noise late at night  but nothing too distracting. That said I would highly recommend the hotel and we will go back when next in Lisbon.

review_title: Comfortable and well located hotel in central Lisbon with exceptionally helpful staff.
review_text:
I had a fantastic two night stay in the deluxe room. The hotel is very well located within walking distance of many attractions and restaurants. My room was large, comfortable and very well put together. The breakfast buffet was much better than average with exceptionally good fresh fruit and gluten-free bread (I have celiac disease) along with all the other things you would expect. However, what really made this stay memorable for me was the exceptionally friendly  staff at the front desk.  They booked a restaurant for me, gave me lots of great tips on sites to see and walking routes, they helped me book a bus to Porto Covo where I am walking the Rota Vicintina, and they set me up on Uber for a ride to the bus terminal.  Highly recommended and would definitely stay here again.

Great location, would definitely recommend and will stay there next time we're in Lisbon.

review_title: Excellent property in great location
review_text:
The staff at this property is excellent. The location was perfect. I did several tours while I was there & it was a short walk to the meeting point of each of them & the train is nearby. There are many restaurants close by. Breakfast includes made to order eggs, fresh fruit, yogurt, breads, meat & cheese, cereals & sweets. It far exceeded my expectations. My room (4) overlooked the street but with the shutters closed I had absolutely no trouble sleeping. (Air conditioning is available in case you get warm.) There is a robe in the room & the bedding was very comfortable. I would not hesitate to recommend this property.

Negative: Breakfast starts at 8, but most tours also start at 8 (or 830 but a short walk is required.) An earlier breakfast or some grab & go options would be great! (I did tell them I was leaving early one morning & they left saltines, a banana & juice outside my door, so theyâ€™re definitely trying!)

Je kan voorkeuren voor het ontbijt opgeven en wordt dat s morgens aan je tafel bezorgd zoals verse jus, yoghurt en eieren worden s morgens vers voor je bereid. Ligging ook erg mooi en alles makkelijk te bereiken.

review_title: PESIMO APESTA A OLOR DE HUMEDAD
review_text:
El desayuno justo

Negative: La habitacion olia a humedad terriblemente y no se podia ventilar ya que daba a la calle directamente y la ventana no abria. Igualmente el olor estaba en las paredes, suelo, cabecero de cama.
El personal dio largas a la solicitud de cambio de habitacion y decia que tenian que hablar con el jefe, al que nunca vimos porque no aparecio y no nos cambiaron de habitacion. 
Nos fuimos una noche antes, de tres noches pagadas usamos dos, solicitamos el reembolso del dinero de la noche no usada si no nos cambiaban de habitacion, no nos dieron ninguna solucion ni nos devolvieron ni un euro por la noche que nos fuimos porque el olor era horrible.
Una pena de vacaciones en un sitio asi!! no lo recomiendo.
La habitacion que nos dieron fue la numero 12, a la calle, el resto no sÃ© como seran, pero desde luego deberian hacerse cargo si te venden una habitacion con esa peste por 190â‚¬ la noche. 
Otra cosa son los pequeÃ±os mantenimientos, la ducha no se mantenia, el boton de wc se quedaba pillado, se cortaba toda la luz de la habitacion de repente...
Muy mal! No vale lo que piden por la habitaciÃ³n.

review_title: Perfetta sistemazione
review_text:
Abbiamo soggiornato 2 notti e abbiamo trovato la sistemazione molto comoda e centrale per poter visitare la cittÃ . A piedi si raggiunge la piazza principale nel quartiere Chiado con tutti i locali e servizi. Lo staff all'hotel Ã¨ stato davvero molto gentile, professionale e disponibile, non ricordo i nomi ma sia le ragazze che i ragazzi alla reception sono stati TOP. Consigli turistici e pratici per visitare al meglio la cittÃ  e il Portogallo (visto che per noi Lisbona era la I tappa). La camera da noi scelta andava bene come dimensioni, spazio, pulizia, letto comodissimo, possibilitÃ  di farsi un caffÃ¨ o un tea al rientro, una bottiglia d'acqua sempre a disposizione. Pulizia sia della stanza che degli altri ambienti. Colazione sia dolce che salata, buona qualitÃ  e varietÃ . Alcuni prodotti freschi (tipo frutta/yoghurt) vanno scelti al momento del check-in, ma per noi non Ã¨ stato un problema. Abbiamo anche richiesto se era possibile anticipare di mezz'ora un giorno la colazione in quanto eravamo diretti a Sintra e tutti molto disponibili e cortesi. All'arrivo e alla partenza consegnano e ritirano loro le valigie in camera. Veramente consigliato. In caso dovessi tornare a Lisbona sceglierÃ² sicuramente questa struttura perÃ² forse una camera piÃ¹ grande e non al piano terra.

Negative: Unica nota negativa che la camera si trova a piano terra e si sente un po' di odore di umido entrando, ma bastava lasciare un po' aperto la finestra. Inoltre nelle vicinanze si trova un locale e la sera si sente un po' di rumore e schiamazzi (siamo capiti nella sera in cui il giorno dopo era festa in Portogallo)

The location was 5 minutes walk to restaurants that were on our list, great cocktails and sights inc tile shops. The staff were so friendly and helpful, especially Claudia! I felt truly happy and welcome. The room was big and comfortable.

Negative: The room was a bit damp (there were damp traps under the bed), which I think was responsible for a slightly wierd smell whenever initially entering the room which seemed to disappear. I did wonder if it affected my throat. It was on a down level but also street level.

The wardrobe was a bit wierd and if you hung two tops they would overlap and could hang dresses; but there was also another bar in the room things could kind of be hung on. Would be good to have somewhere to put long floaty summer dresses!

Light wasn't great in the room (or air) as you were on a back street level opposite a wine bar so don't want to invite or let others see in.

This is a lovely little gem of a hotel.  It has a wonderful location and easily walkable to most of the major shopping and eating areas.  It's a few blocks from the Metro station so it's easy to get anywhere.  The rooms were very clean and comfortable with great A/C.  The only drawback is that the street behind the hotel can be loud with the sound of cars on cobblestones.
The entire staff.was wonderfully helpful and very available during our stay.

Best breakfast I have had anywhere. Had fresh bread cheese ham . Followed by made to order omelette. Fresh fruit salad and yoghurt.  Had to leave room for the amazing almond Portuguese tart. Plenty of coffee from catering size Nespresso machine Needless to say didnâ€™t need any lunch .

Room was large airy and immaculate. Very comfortable mattress, very good shower. 

Staff were so friendly , helpful and pleasant. They made our stay. Nothing was too much bother. 

Canâ€™t wait to return to Lisbon and would not book anywhere else. It really is first class . Thank you to all staff for the warmest of welcomes.

review_title: Extraordinary Service and Comfort
review_text:
Location was very good, room was spacious, comfortable and quiet.  Breakfast was really excellent with personalized service and made-to-order eggs as well as delicious fruit and yogurt among other things.  Hotel entrance is quite secure.  All that is great but most of all it is the incredible staff that makes this hotel what it is.  You could pay $1000 per night for a luxury hotel and not have a more gracious and caring staff provide such personal attention.  Our flight to Lisbon arrived early in the morning.  We went to the hotel with the hope that we could just drop off our luggage and go out for 6 or 7 hours until check-in.  Instead Claudia invited us to the Hotel's breakfast and found us a comfortable space to rest until our room was ready.  Ultimately we were able to check in hours early.  Then Lara at the front desk asked us what we wanted to do in Lisbon and gave us many excellent suggestions.  All the staff were just so caring and friendly.  A great experience!

We checked-in late in the night and he made sure he kept in touch prior to check-in. Overall, we had a great time at this hotel. It was very close to all major sites. We wished we had stayed longer.

review_title: Great place to stay
review_text:
The staff were fanatic, they helped with everything, restaurant suggestions to carrying your luggage
Great location
Breakfast was excellent

Once Upon A House is perfection.

Somewhat like going back in time to an exquisitely decorated house with many tastefully decorated rooms.

From the moment we checked in we felt really comfortable and at home.

Our room was spacious, which for hotel rooms now is unusual.  We had a very comfortable large bed, a table and comfortable chairs.

There was all manner of lighting options, a coffee machine and tea making facilities.

The bathroom was large with his and his sinks.  Beautiful products at the sinks and in the shower.

Breakfast for us was again perfect.  When you check in they go through fresh options which are delivered to your breakfast table every morning by the sweetest girls who run the breakfast show.

In the centre of the breakfast room are meats, cheeses, beautiful breads, cakes, cereals and a wealth of options.  Eggs can be ordered to your specification and the cheese, ham, tomatoes scrambled eggs were cooked to perfection.

There is very comfortable seating in the lobby and by the breakfast room and an honesty bar should you desire an aperitivo.

The position of the hotel is also perfect for the lovely areas of Chiado and Biaxa with the metro station a 5 minute walk.

Book this hotel and you will not be disappointed as for us as our first impression of Lisbon could not have been better.

We only spent 3 nights there but could have spent more and at some point will return.

Thank you Alecrim ao Chiado.

We arrived early and lounged in the common area while they focused on getting our room ready. We really felt like we were their friends rather than guest in a hotel. The included breakfast was fantastic, everything you could imagine, buffet style PLUS made to order eggs. Our TV wasn't working when we arrived and within hours they had a repairman there to replace the cable box. Location is perfect...central to everything. Our room was huge and well equipped.

We enjoyed a wonderful stay here for a few days in December.  The staff are exceptionally helpful, speak great English and have an excellent knowledge of the local area.  The hotel is tasteful and cleaned every day to a high standard with extras in our suite room such as a coffee machine, water and bathrobes.  Bed was large and comfortable. Breakfast had a good selection of cereals, breads, meat, cheese, fruit and pastries.  Eggs are also offered, cooked to your taste each day.  The interior of the whole building is so interesting and I loved the Christmas decorations and artefacts on display.

Negative: I would recommend this hotel as a great place to stay in Lisbon unless you had mobility issues in which case the stairs inside and position on a hill may prove challenging.

review_title: Great location, amazing staffs and cozy room with a perfect location
review_text:
This is a perfect location for first time Lisbon explorer. The hotel is self is located right in the heart of all the good tourist spots in Lisbon, with everything being walking distance away. Itâ€™s clean, cozy, and yet feeling so private. It feels more like a holiday house than your traditional/ impersonal hotel. The staffs at the hotel are exceedingly lovely and helpful. 

I must comment on the hotel breakfast. Whilst some reviews note the breakfast to be limited, we have the opposite experience. We found the breakfast to be excellent! It has reasonable variety. Most importantly, each item was of high quality. For example, they provided home made yogurt, homemade pastry and freshly cut fruit salad each morning, in addition to other buffet options. We have found the quality of breakfast to be better than other 5 stars hotels weâ€™ve stayed in. I highly recommend this hotel and cannot wait to come back again!
review_response:
Dear Yu,
First of all we would like to thank you for taking the time to write such a detailed review of your stay. It was a great pleasure to have you as a guest and we are very grateful to have given you such a pleasant experience. Our aim is to make our guests feel at home. Your description and subsequent evaluation of our breakfast makes us very happy, as there's nothing like starting the day with a great meal. Hope to host you again in the near future.
Warm Regards,
Alecrim Team

review_text:

The breakfast area downstairs was fabulous, oozing with character. All the food was of  a high quality and eggs were cooked to order. The area itself is quite compact, however, so when the hotel is busy there are occasions when a table is not available.

Reception staff were extremely helpful and friendly. We had an issue with lost luggage on arrival in Lisbon and the staff were so obliging in helping us liaise with the airport and getting our luggage delivered to the hotel.

We thoroughly enjoyed our 4 nights a Alecrim au Chiado.

review_title: An Exceptional Boutique Hotel
review_text:
A truly beautiful boutique hotel
Large comfortable room, beds, pillows, decor, cleanliness, ambiance. Perfect location to walk downhill to the train station or a short walk to the little tram stop
Delicious breakfast with eggs cooked to order & friendly ladies in the kitchen
The standout for us was the genuine care & helpfulness extended to us by Victor, Goncalo & Claudia. Ask them anything & they are so willing to help with recommendations for places to visit, how to get there, places to eat & all proved to be excellent suggestions 
We saw so much in such a short amount of time & all thanks to their wonderful help

Negative: Turning on the shower, for us was tricky
Just ask for a demo of how it all works
Ingenious really
review_response:

We're dedicated to providing memorable experiences, and your satisfaction lets us know we're on the right track. We were very flattered not only by your review, but also for the warm comments about our team. We are delighted to have contributed to making your stay in Lisbon a memorable one. . We hope to host you again in the near future.
Warm Regards,

The staff are super friendly & will do there utmost to help you with anything you might need. The room was comfortable, clean & we loved the history & the little touches of its architecture. Breakfast was yummy & plentiful. It was positioned well & we could walk to most things we wanted to see or catch the near by train.

review_title: Great very central boutique hotel with fantastic staff
review_text:
When we we  pulled up we were  underwhelmed with the entrance. But once inside we were more than happy with our choice. The hotel is an old house which still retains some of the features of  the old building but the rooms have been thoroughly mondernised. There are a few stairs ( up & down ) to negotiate but the staff are more than willing to help with luggage. Absolutely loved our stay here. Very  central to beachfront, cafes and restaurants. Had a number of meals with buskers playing within 200 mtrs of the hotel. Staff were very helpful with everything we wanted to do.

Breakfast was delicious, with fresh fruit, charcuterie, pastries and eggs cooked to order by lovely staff. The hotel is in an ideal location, close to the river and to Baixa-Chiado metro station. Iâ€™d definitely recommend this hotel.

As the temps outside were 97-104 degrees, A/C was critical and it kept the room very comfortable. Included breakfast was wonderful, with an attentive staff who also make omelets to order. Claudia pays close attention to detail, which no doubt accounts for how impeccable the property is.  Loved â€œBy the Wineâ€ on backstreet Ruas das Flores with great atmosphere, food, wine variety and just steps from our room. On a busy street, but didnâ€™t find it noisy.  Ideal location with short walk to the river, train station, Pink Street and Rossio Square.  Secured building and in an area that felt very safe to us. We were with a larger group that stayed at a more expensive hotel and after seeing their property we were so happy we chose Alecrim.

Negative: The staff never made it seem bothersome, but instead of having them take time out of their busy schedule to fill water bottles, it would be nice to have a filtered water station where we could have poured our own water.  It was 95+ degrees outside during our stay and one morning we left before the staff arrived so were not able to fill our bottles.

My room was large, comfortable bed, cleaned every day (I was there for 4 nights).
I will certainly stay here again when I am next in Lisbon.

The wallpaper, furnishings, stone steps all remind you of this house's heritage. This continues to the bedrooms where everything is thoughtfully laid out right down to the glass water bottle on the table and the folded bath robes in the drawer. We loved the double set of French doors too. The hotel staff are friendly, welcoming and helpful (especially Claudia) and it is located in an excellent area where you can walk to most things.

Negative: Our room was beautiful but it did not have a fridge. We were, however, able to use the fridge in the hotel kitchen to store our drinks. The bed was also harder than we would have preferred. Minor complaints compared to what was on offer.

review_text:
Proprietors are very nice and helpful.  Location great.  room clean and large. Breakfast very good. several places to stay in hotel outside of your room.  Coffee in room. a/c worked great.  There was a table with comfortable chairs in room and safe.  It met all of our requirements, except a small fridge.  It was very nice.

Negative: The bed was too hard for us.  The toilet in the room was a bit dangerous to get to.  There were 4 steep steps about 11 inches or so tall, much  more than the standard size steps in the US.  It was very easy to stumble especially getting up in the night.  I would suggest you ask for a room without steep  steps to get to the bathroom.  Then all should be good!

review_title: great location and super friendly people, a few steps to negotiate but staff always offered to help
Decent, but room for improvement.
review_text:
The location, the boutique feel, and the breakfast was nice. Sameer stayed and waited for us for our late check in ( 9:30PM) because our flight was delayed. He is an amazing polite, respectful young man. By far he was the reason our stay was enjoyable.

Negative: We got a deluxe suite, and there was no minibar, or chested drawers.The shower was licking as well.
Also my husband wanted to work on his laptop in the waiting hidden area of the lobby, and the cleaning lady, said he was not allowed to be there because she wanted to clean the carpets. When husband went to the front desk and ask the lady up front about the situation ( donâ€™t know her name, but she had short curly hair), she didnâ€™t seem of much of help.
She was not friendly at all. Seems like they rather clean the carpet, than let the guesses work in the laptop for 30 minutes while there were people resting in the suite.
review_response:
Dear Diana,

Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback. While we are pleased to hear that you appreciated our location, boutique atmosphere, breakfast, and especially Sameerâ€™s exceptional professionalism and dedication during your late check-in, we would also like to address the concerns you raised.

Regarding the minibar, we would like to clarify that we do not offer a minibar, and this information is clearly stated on Booking.com. As for the leaking shower, we sincerely apologize. We always strive to pay close attention to details, and in this case, we fell short.

We also apologize for the inconvenience experienced in the lobby. Our guests are always our priority. We are confident that our colleagues did not intend to cause any inconvenience, as our staff is well known for being kind and accommodating. We believe this was a misunderstanding; however, we sincerely apologize for the situation.
The matter has been addressed internally, and action has been taken to ensure guests are always prioritized and treated with respect.

We appreciate you bringing this to our attention and regret that these issues impacted your stay.

Wishing you Happy Holidays!

Warm regards,

review_text: The hotel itself was charming; however, the room we were given was right next to the front desk on the first floor, facing a busy street. We could hear conversations from the front desk, which made it feel like we had little privacy. Unfortunately, someone had also left the windows open before our arrival, and we didnâ€™t realize it until later. We stayed for two nights, but both the first night and the following day were very noisy due to loud street noise â€” people talking and shouting, likely from nearby bars â€” which made it extremely difficult to relax and sleep. Breakfast was okay, but overall, I had a poor experience and wouldnâ€™t choose to stay here again.
review_response: Dear Shiho, Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback. We're truly sorry to hear that your experience did not meet your expectations and that your stay was impacted by noise from both the street and our front desk area. We understand how important a quiet and restful environment is for our guests, and we regret that we fell short in this regard during your visit. We also apologize for the oversight with the windows being left open prior to your arrival.That is certainly not the standard we strive to uphold. Please know that your comments have been shared with our team so we can take steps to ensure similar issues do not occur in the future. While weâ€™re glad you found the hotel charming and breakfast acceptable, we are disappointed to learn that these aspects were not enough to improve your overall impression. We genuinely hope you might consider giving us another opportunity in the future, perhaps in a quieter room away from the street. Warm Regards, Alecrim Team

It was also moldy.  The sheets were clean and the room was well maintained. The location is very convenient- that is why I didnâ€™t give this place 1 star. I would not stay here again though.

The room was spacious, comfortable, tastefully decorated and had a well-appointed bathroom with quality soap and shampoo in wall dispensers. And the small table for two overlooking the small balcony was delightful. Wish weâ€™d been in Lisbon more than one night - we would have happily stayed a few days!
